message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms are consistent with carpal tunnel syndrome, and the confirmatory test is nerve conduction studies. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) may be used to rule out other causes. Nerve biopsy is not typically indicated in the diagnosis of carpal tunnel syndrome, and Tinel test is a physical examination technique used to elicit symptoms but not confirm the diagnosis.
